entry.title: üáÆüá≥ SAP Build: Create Event-Based Processes (Bengaluru, India)
entry.content:
This is the all-new SAP CodeJam for SAP Build low-code/no-code tooling that focuses on giving you hands-on experience for building event-triggered processes with SAP Build Process Automation.

You will build an event-based scenario that lets users create S/4HANA business partners, setting off a process where:

  1. An employee approves the creation of a site access badge.
  2. A second employee, determined based on the details of the business partner, may also need to approve the badge.
  3. The process calls an external, 3rd-party badge system and waits to be called back.
  4. A user creates the badge and the badge system calls back the process instance.
  5. A notification with the badge ID is sent.

The scenario is built in 2 halves:

  • SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh: You will learn about events, CloudEvents, events in the SAP landscape, the process for publishing and subscribing to events, and your way around SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. Then, you will create a REST Delivery Point in advanced event mesh to forward events to your SAP Build on your SAP BTP trial account.
  • SAP Build Process Automation: You will create a process from scratch to handle the issuance of site access badges. You will learn the basics of SAP Build Process Automation (projects, triggers, conditions, creating instances, monitoring, and the Inbox), and also use some of the more recent or advanced features (event triggers, form events, waiting for a API callback).

Prerequisites

  • Bring your own laptop with power adapter and have a supported Web browser such as Google Chrome or Firefox installed on your laptop.
  • It can be helpful to bring a tablet or second laptop, if you have.
  • Complete these prerequisites and the required reading BEFORE you come: 
    • Introduction to the CodeJam
    • Prerequisites
    • Required reading:
      • 1 - Exploring Events and More in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub
      • 2 - Why Event-Driven Architectures?

Location and Date 

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Thrusday, July 17, 2025 from 09:00 - 14:00 local time in Bengaluru, India. The language of the event and the content will be English.

Event Address: Building BLR05 (Room - SAP Hive) @ SAP Labs, EPIP Zone Whitefield Road, KIADB Export Promotion Industrial Area, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

  • The instructors are SAP Developer Advocates @ajay_soreng, @ajmaradiaga and @eshrinivasan.

Please note that spaces are limited! We can only accommodate 30 attendees. If you want to attend, register by clicking the Yes button in the Will you be attending? section above to the right. About two weeks before the event, you will be asked to confirm your attendance.

entry.title: Re: publicaciones en ingles?
entry.content:
Hola @Darling_Astudillo,

Antes que nada, bienvenida a la SAP Community.

Es cierto que la gran mayoria del contenido en la plataforma es en ingles pero claro que podes publicar en tu idioma nativo. En SAP Community podes encontrar contenido en otros idiomas, por ej. portugues, japones, chino, etc. Dicho eso, existe una comunidad SAP hispanohablante bastante importante. Yo personalmente he publicado contenido en espa√±ol aqui hace mucho tiempo.... pero la gran mayoria es en ingles. Tambien, si publicas algo en espa√±ol siempre podes utilizar algo como Google Translate para traducirlo e incluirlo en el mismo blog post. Inclusive, podria ser algo como un link a la herramienta de Google Translate y asi la gente que no habla espa√±ol tambien lo puede acceder, por ej. https://community-sap-com.translate.goog/t5/welcome-corner-discussions/publicaciones-en-ingles/td-p/14127525?_x_tr_sl=es&_x_tr_tl=en&_x_tr_hl=en-US&_x_tr_pto=wapp.

Dependiendo de donde estas, podes tambien encontrar en SAP Community grupos hispanohablantes y te podes unir a ellos - Americas y en Espa√±a hay un par.

Por ultimo, hay gente que tambien crea contenido en espa√±ol relacionado con el mundo SAP... te recomiendo que les des un vistazo:

  • @AAncos : https://aancos.com
  • @Sandra_Solis : Mundo ABAPER

entry.title: SAP Community Escape House for July ‚Äì SAP Cloud Application Event Hub ‚öΩÔ∏è üèÜ üèüÔ∏è
entry.content:
The seventh SAP Developer Challenge of the year is now available! The Developer Advocates have created the SAP Community Escape House - a virtual escape house (consisting of multiple rooms) that you can play in your browser. Read on for all the details.

SAP Developer Challenges are all about having fun, trying new things, and learning along the way. You can also earn a badge in the SAP Community upon successful completion. For this year, all SAP Developer Challenges will happen in the SAP Community Escape House. For each challenge, we will unlock a new room in the house, and they all have a specific focus topic. Completing a challenge means successfully escaping the room by solving a series of coding-related tasks/questions. This month is all about events between SAP cloud applications, specifically the BTP service - SAP Cloud Application Event Hub.

How to participate

Visit the SAP Community Escape House and enter your numeric SAP Community user ID. If you don't know your user ID, go to your SAP Community profile. You can find the numeric ID at the end of the URL.

SAP Community Escape House - Enter your SAP Community ID


Once you see the SAP Community Escape House, select the SAP Cloud Application Event Hub room and start exploring it.

The user interface of an escape room includes the room itself as well as a terminal. You can click the objects in the room to receive tips. Like in a real (physical) escape room, you will have to try out a few things and explore the room until you receive helpful tips and, eventually, instructions. These tips and instructions are printed on the terminal next to the room. The terminal is also used to submit solutions to tasks. Read the instructions you receive carefully to understand how.

 

If you successfully escape the room (you will know when that happens), you will receive a badge in the SAP Community. We will assign the badges once the challenge closes.

The schedule

The SAP Cloud Application Event Hub room will be unlocked on July 1st and will stay unlocked until the end of the year. However, the challenge closes on July 31st, so you must escape the room until then to qualify for a badge. Unlike the previous year, this SAP Developer Challenge does not consist of weekly sub-challenges. The next room (next challenge) will be unlocked in August.

Good luck and happy escaping!

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite CodeJam roadshow in India - recap
entry.content:
What an eventful week it was! (No pun intended)..... Together with @ajay_soreng, we did one SAP CodeJam per day - 3 different cities (Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Bengaluru), 5 different locations, 3 different topics (SAP Integration Suite, SAP Build Process Automation, and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh).

Everything was planned to perfection but I had a mental misstep. I mistakenly thought that there was a visa on arrival when traveling to India when in reality it requires applying for an e-visa. Unfortunately, I only found this when I was doing my check-in - Saturday, exactly 12 hours before my flight, a bit late right? I immediately applied for an e-visa but given that it was a Saturday I had to wait till Monday for a resolution. Don't get me wrong, the e-visa process is really good and fast but you can't expect much when you end up applying for it too late.

The adventure only starts here...I joined the first event remotely, from Madrid. Once I receive the e-visa approval, I had 4.5 hours to catch the next plane leaving Madrid heading to India. The second event, I also joined it remotely, but this time from Abu Dhabi. The plane touched ground at 06:35, after going through security, I immediate started searching for a quiet place to join the 2nd CodeJam of the week. Fortunately, I found one :-). Straight after the event, I boarded a plane to Hyderabad - not kidding, I was walking to the gate as we were wrapping up the event. I closed my laptop a minute before boarding. Finally, I made it to Hyderabad Tuesday night and I was able to join the last three events in-person. I sincerely want to apologise to the attendees of the first two events as I wasn't able to be there in-person but it was great meeting you virtually; also, doing the event remotely would have not been possible if it wasn't for the great help and support from @ajay_soreng and @Shilpa_Shankar - Thanks to you both!

Apart from the physical badges (stickers) that many of the attendees got. All attendees of the different SAP CodeJams will get a special SAP Community badge for attending the events ü™™.

 

 

Mumbai

In Mumbai we did the Connecting systems and services using SAP Integration Suite CodeJam at Colgate office. Thanks Colgate for hosting!

We recently introduced a new exercise where we interact with Slack and send notifications from Cloud Integration to Slack. It was exciting to see many attendees posting their notifications even after the event finished.

Hyderabad

In Hyderabad it was all about SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. We ran the Event-driven integrations CodeJam at two different locations. Thanks Mindset and Infosys for hosting the events. I joined the first one remotely from Abu Dhabi and finally in-person for the second event. 

Bengaluru

Last city part of the SAP Integration Suite CodeJam roadshow. At Bengaluru, we ran the new SAP Build: Event-based processes and also the Connecting systems and services with SAP Integration Suite CodeJams at SAP Labs Bengaluru and Mindset Consulting, thanks for hosting. We were fortunate enough to be joined by the entire SAP Developer Advocates team based in India ( @sheenamk, @eshrinivasan, @Rekha_DR, @Shilpa_Shankar), as well as by @acharyaw - PM for SAP Build Process Automation.

 

Food

Last but certainly not least... all the lovely food that we enjoyed as part of the roadshow. Thanks to all the hosts.... the food was amazing everywhere haha.

Lots of lessons learned from the mental misstep and there might be cool things and opportunities coming up thanks to it. Also, this wouldn't have been possible without @ajay_soreng's help organising the events and supporting me while I was remotely - Thanks!

entry.title: Re: üá®üá¥ SAP CodeJam ABAP Cloud (Bogota, Colombia)
entry.content: Que eso no te detenga‚Ä¶ el resto habla espa√±ol y entre todos te apoyamos. Saludos!

entry.title: üî¥ Pipeline for Cloud Integration
entry.content: Learn in this session how the Pipeline for Cloud Integration can help you to accelerate your transformation from SAP Process Orchestration to the cloud.

entry.title: üî¥ Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
"Clean core is the foundation of modern SAP implementations‚Äîbut achieving it while maintaining seamless integration across your enterprise landscape is one of the biggest challenges developers face today.

In this session, you‚Äôll learn how SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) empowers developers to overcome these hurdles and unlock greater value from both SAP and non-SAP systems.

We‚Äôll explore how to rethink business processes as events. You‚Äôll see how AEM helps you liberate data from silos, stream it across systems, filter for what matters, and react in real time‚Äîwhile enabling secure, democratized access across your organization.

We‚Äôll also introduce the concept of micro integrations‚Äîa practical architectural pattern that simplifies complex system interactions and promotes agility, all while supporting a cleaner core.

Through a hands-on demo, we‚Äôll showcase multiple micro integration scenarios, including one using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) plugin, illustrating how to build responsive, decoupled SAP solutions.

Whether you're extending SAP, integrating services, or driving agility with SAP BTP, this session will give you the tools and perspective to evolve your integration strategy‚Äîwithout compromising the core."

entry.title: üî¥ Enterprise in Motion: Event-Driven Architecture Use Cases for Innovation and Agility
entry.content: Discover how event-driven architecture (EDA) can transform enterprises. This session starts with a quick introduction to EDA, presents real-world use cases, explores common patterns, and offers practical tips for identifying EDA opportunities. Developers will learn how to leverage EDA for greater flexibility, scalability, and responsiveness in their enterprise projects.

entry.title: üî¥ Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the new Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content: In this session, we will introduce the new SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, event add-on for ERP. The overview will explain the value of the add-on when event-enabling SAP systems, when to use it, how to get started, and commercial aspects.

entry.title: üî¥ Hands-on session: practical demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content: In this session, we will demonstrate how to configure events in the Event Add-on for ERP and send them to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. You will learn how the add-on reacts to changes in the SAP system, turns them into events, and then seamlessly integrates with the broker, while benefiting from advanced features like Dynamic Topics and Async API specifications for Event Portal.

entry.title: üî¥ Seamless side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
entry.content:
An example on how to realize SAP‚Äôs strategy for clean core through side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build.
This session will provide an overview of the relevant capabilities from SAP Build, north star architecture and do a deep dive into how it is realized using SAP Cloud Application Event Hub. SAP Build already leverages this integration into supporting seamless integration with SuccessFactors and S/4 HANA. The presenters will go through how the journey looks from an end user and from an application provider‚Äôs perspectives. Details such as overall architecture and technical prerequisites will also be covered, including combining all the relevant pieces into a ‚Äúhow-to‚Äù integrate guide.

entry.title: üî¥ Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Join us for an immersive session that explores the power of event-driven and API-based automation using SAP Build Process Automation. In today‚Äôs connected enterprise, automation needs to be responsive, scalable, and tightly integrated with core systems like SAP S/4HANA and SAP SuccessFactors. This session offers a deep dive into the key enablers that make that possible.

We‚Äôll begin with an overview of API triggers, showcasing how external systems can initiate workflows through exposed APIs. Then, we‚Äôll uncover the power of Intermediate Message Events (IMEs)‚Äîan essential tool for designing asynchronous, API-driven processes.

You'll also gain insights into setting up the Unified Connectivity Layer (UCL) and Event Broker, forming the backbone for scalable event handling in SAP Build.

Through live demos, you‚Äôll witness two real-world scenarios:
üîπSales Order integration with SAP S/4HANA, demonstrating how APIs and IMEs work together
üîπSuccessFactors onboarding event trigger, where events initiate workflow via the SAP Cloud Application Event Hub setup

Whether you're a developer, architect, or business process expert, this session will equip you with the knowledge to build intelligent, integrated, and event-aware automations.

entry.title: üî¥ A(P)I: Unified connectivity for AI applications using MCP
entry.content: This session will demonstrate how to connect AI-powered applications to external data sources, facilitating real-time AI-to-data integrations using a standardized mechanism based on the Model Context Protocol (MCP). We will explore key concepts of MCP, then put theory into practice with hands-on examples. Beyond exploring opportunities, applications and scenarios this technology enables, the session will also discuss typical operational challenges and security threats encountered when deploying and using MCP servers.

entry.title: üî¥ IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)
entry.content:
Developers often face challenges understanding the IT system landscape: What systems exist, what services do they offer, and how can they be integrated? Open Resource Discovery (ORD) addresses this issue by providing an open-source standard for decentralized system descriptions. ORD details available APIs, events, data products, and AI resources, along with their contracts and documentation.

In this talk, we will explain what ORD is, the problems it solves, and why we created it. We will also discuss how SAP leverages ORD to publish a static catalog of offerings, enable real-time landscape introspection, and support products like SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Business Data Cloud, and SAP Build.

Additionally, we will present how we have built an ecosystem to simplify ORD adoption, helping developers identify issues earlier and improve the quality of metadata and documentation over time for both SAP and our customers.

Finally, we will share our current thinking on how ORD can benefit the AI ecosystem.

entry.title: üî¥ AI for Integration Excellence: Modernize, Optimize, Thrive
entry.content: In today's digital ecosystem, integration is not only strategic priority to connect fragmented IT landscape but a key-enabler of AI driven automated businesses. This session delves into the transformative power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in redefining iPaaS by boosting developer productivity, enhancing operational efficiency, and modernizing integration strategies. Participants will gain insights into SAP Integration Suite's recently released AI features as well as construe the AI roadmap and direction.

entry.title: üî¥ Partner Directory Accelerator Tool for Pipeline Concept - an SAP open-source project
entry.content: Based on your knowledge about the Pipeline Concept, in this session, we explore the Partner Directory Accelerator Tool, available as SAP open-source project. Developed specifically for the Pipeline Concept, this tool accelerates the creation and maintenance of relevant Partner Directory content. Learn how to setup and use the tool and its key features, such as XSLT generation and replication of content in different tenants of a landscape.
